alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale; Geneva; Henry; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 27 at 2:05PM CDT until September 28 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A critical combination of strong winds, low humidity, and dry fuels will be in place across southeast Alabama and portions of the western Florida panhandle Wednesday afternoon... .Northeast winds will strengthen as low level winds strengthen in response to the approach of Hurricane Ian towards the western Florida peninsula. These strong winds will also usher in drier air with afternoon relative humidity values falling in the low to mid 20 percent range. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM EDT WEDNESDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY FOR southeast Alabama and portions of the western Florida panhandle... The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon to 8 PM EDT Wednesday. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zones 065, 066, 067, 068, and 069.Fire weather zones 007, 008, 009, 010, and 011. * WIND...Northeast winds 15 to 20 mph with higher gusts. * HUMIDITY...23 to 27 percent. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
